text: Paul Martin Dahlø (29 August 1885 - 2 May 1967) was a Norwegian politician for the Labour Party. He was elected to the Norwegian Parliament from Sør- Trøndelag in 1945, and was re-elected on two occasions. He had previously served as a deputy representative during the terms 1928-1930, 1931-1933 and 1937-1945\. Dahlø was born in Frøya and a member of Sør-Frøya municipality council between 1925 and 1955, except for a period between 1941 and 1945. He served as mayor in the periods 1934-1937, 1937-1941 and 1945-1947\. Outside politics, he was a fisher. He was a member of the board of Norges sildesalslag 1936-1945, Fiskernes samkjøp 1938-1950 and Norges Fiskarlag 1945-1951. ==References== * Category:1885 births Category:1967 deaths Category:Labour Party (Norway) politicians Category:Members of the Storting Category:Mayors of Frøya, Sør- Trøndelag Category:20th-century Norwegian politicians
title: Paul Martin Dahlø
